data.title: Small, different, but Very Tasty
data.text:
We tried Ravens last week, thinking we could try some pizza and drink a couple of beers.
We found out very quickly that they did not sell beer and decided to walk out when my wife said "Lets try it", so we ordered the meat pizza with jalapenos. The Pizza is Awesome! light, tasty, and if anyone remembers the Mr Gattis pizza taste, this is what you are going to get. Very Very tasty and I didn't even  mind that I didn't have a beer. The place is small but a main TV is showing various programs. We didn't think that it was appropriate that the Rocky Horror Picture show was showing due to the fact that a lot of young kids were sitting down watching TV, but it was not our home to choose what was being played. If you loved Mr Gattis Pizza, this is the place to eat, Just remember, they do not sell beer, and it is a very small place.

data.title: Hidden treasure
data.text: Okay - it doesn't look like much.  It's an old house and needs a fresh coat of paint.  But someone told me that the sub sandwiches here reminded them of the ones we used to get at the original Mr. Gatti's in town - so, we gave it a try.  So glad we did!  The subs were REALLY good, the spaghetti lunch special was very tasty, and the pizza was outstanding.  Not gonna win any awards for décor - but the food is well done.  Recommended.

data.title: love it
data.text: The pizza is really good, but I also love their chili cheese fries. My husband enjoys their trail dog and burgers. Only thing that didn't impress me was the potato soup, it was bland. Restaurant needs a deep clean but the food is worth going.

data.title: Walk in
data.text:
Place was completely empty of customers took only 15 minutes to wait on me to see what i wanted....
Food was ok I guess but service was way out there somewhere standing in his field

data.title: One of the BEST burgers in Town
data.text: Nearly every time we come home from the lake we call in an order for 4 burgers on sour dough buns.   Great fries, too!  I haven't eaten anything but their cheese burgers... I can't pass them up.   Not so great on the atmosphere, but a big screen TV gives you something to look at and the service is friendly.

data.title: EXCELLENT FOOD
data.text: This little restaurant is a favorite of mine. Home-cooked meals, daily specials. Inexpensive. These folks are very friendly and they take care you.

data.title: YUMMY PIZZA! FRIENDLY PEOPLE!
data.text: It is a small cute cozy little dining place. I usually get their cheesy bread that does not lack on the cheese! Their pizza is yummy, especially the Victorian (Supreme). When I call in an order they always know my name. I love places that do their best to remember every customer that does business with them.

data.title: Small place, friendly staff, will return
data.text: The place is small, but definitely has a personality.  The 2 people we encountered were very nice.  Philly cheese steak sandwich and fries were good.  Chicken sandwich was dry, strips were small and the pizza was ok (ordered 1 piece but got 2, though the crust was not high quality).  Saturday lunch was quite slow.  Salad bar was small, but fresh.  A/c felt nice.  Prices are good.  We will go back and try some other things.  They deliver too.

data.title: Good pizza place!
data.text:
A small home-like environment.  We meet here for lunch for a quick sandwich or pizza.  Sometimes the portions seem small,  but the
pizza & other Italian foods are really good.

data.title: A Family Place With Great Food!
data.text: If you want more home cooking this is another great place in Victoria. They too serve home style cooking but if I had to choose which particular cuisine is the best I prefer the home made pizza. It even has a name. Its called the Victorian and is simply fantastic! This is a must go to place!
